_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Five factors an anointed aristocratic ki: Well born on both his mother’s and father’s side, of pure descent, irrefutable and impeccable in questions of ancestry back to the seventh paternal generation.
Rich, affluent, and wealthy, with a full treasury and storehouses.
Powerful, having an army of four divisions that is obedient and carries out instructions.
Has a counselor who is astute, competent, and intelligent, able to think issues through as they bear upon the past, future, and present.
Five qualities a mendicant lives with mi: Ethical, restrained in the monastic code, conducting themselves well and seeking alms in suitable places.
Very learned, remembering and keeping what they’ve learned.
Live with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities.
Wise, having the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
